intro: Bladhia quinquegona, commonly known as the five-lobed bladhia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
